mdRecord.dcterms:title: Audiometer replica
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Dr. R. Quisling [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: One of the first audiometers was developed by David Edward Hughes in 1879 using an induction coil system. A commercial version was manufactured by Thomas Hawsley around 1885 in London, England. This replica was built by Dr. R. Quisling of Harrisonburg, Virginia, during the mid to late 20th century.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: audiometers
models (representations)
